data.description:
(Requires attunement by a Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard)

You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic quarterstaff. When you hit with a melee attack using this staff, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 1d6 force damage to the target. While holding it you gain a +2 bonus to AC, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

While holding this staff, you can use an action to expend charges to cast one of the following spells, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus:

  • magic missile (1 charge)

  • ray of enfeeblement (1 charge)

  • levitate (2 charges)

  • hold monster (5 charges)

  • lightning bolt (5th-level, 5 charges)

  • wall of force (5 charges)

  • cone of cold (5 charges)

  • fireball (5th-level, 5 charges)

  • globe of invulnerability (6 charges).

The staff has 20 charges and regains 2d8+4 expended charges each dawn.

When the last charge is expended, roll a d20. On a 20, the staff immediately regains 1d8+2 charges. On a 1, the staff loses its magical properties, apart from its +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

Retributive Strike. You can use an action to destroy the staff, releasing its magic in a 30-foot-radius explosion. Roll a d6:

Even: You teleport to a random plane of existence and avoid the explosion.

Odd: You take damage equal to 16 x the remaining charges.

Every other creature in the area makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature takes damage based on how far away it is from the point of origin, as on the Retributive Strike table below. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

TABLE: RETRIBUTIVE STRIKE

DISTANCE FROM ORIGIN (DAMAGE)

  • 0 to 10 feet (8 x remaining charges)

  • 11 to 20 feet (6 x remaining charges)

  • 21 to 30 feet (4 x remaining charges)
